Key Match Events: Jaylen Wells and Jaren Jackson Jr. scored 20 points each for the Grizzlies
Jay Huff connected on three consecutive 3-pointers and capped the run off with an offensive rebound leading to a reverse dunk
Pre-Game Insights: The Lakers played without starting center Anthony Davis due to left heel soreness
Rui Hachimura was also out with an illness, giving rookie Dalton Knect his first NBA start
Grizzlies coach Taylor Jenkins missed the game due to a death in the family, with assistant coach Tuomas Iisalo leading the team
Post-Match Reflections: There was no immediate word on the extent of Ja Morant's injury
LeBron James led the Lakers with 39 points, while Austin Reaves added 19 despite going 2 for 9 from 3-point range
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Grizzlies used their 3-point shooting to beat the Lakers 131-114
Memphis held a 72-68 lead in the third quarter when reserve Jay Huff connected on three consecutive 3-pointers
Neither team attempts a lot of 3-pointers compared to the rest of the league, but Memphis was shooting 48% from outside the arc at the midway point of the fourth period
Others: The Lakers host Philadelphia on Friday while the Grizzlies host Washington
